intro: Lilium chalcedonicum var. serotinum, commonly known as the late-flowering fritillary, is a variant of the chalcedony lily. It is characterized by its striking white to pale pink flowers with a distinctive red or orange blotch at the base of each petal. This perennial herb is native to the mountainous regions of central and eastern Europe. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are arranged in a basal rosette. It blooms in late summer to early autumn, making it a notable addition to late-season gardens.
